result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: **06-01-16/Post conviction hearing, Court orders the sentence imposed on 12-04-15 is MODIFIED to read as follows: Sentence is WITHHELD, 2 YEARS OF PROBATION REMAIN; SAME CONDITIONS AS PREVIOUSLY ORDERED.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Maintain full time employment or attend school.

Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.

No Contact with victim Sara P.
No illegal drugs or alcohol.

Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.
Cooperate fully with probation agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel Nieves-Martinez

records.addlTxt: No reply from the defendant or surety. vp

Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500) gj
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: As to the order dated/signed 06-01-16 JOC modified to WITHHELD sentence for two years with same conditions are previously ordered.
Signed and filed:  Order Modifying Sentence.

Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in court with attorney Raymond E. Schrank.  Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in custody.  
Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court on defense motion to modify sentence.  Sworn:  Spanish Interpreter Sarah Chwaszczewski.
Hearing proceeded.  Stipulation to Modify Sentence, received and filed.  Statements made by counsels.

Based upon stipulation of the parties and hearing held the grants motion to modify sentence.  
The Court orders the sentence imposed on 12-04-15 MODIFIED as follows:

Sentence is WITHELD.  2 YEARS OF PROBATION REMAIN; SAME CONDITIONS AS PREVIOUSLY ORDERED. 

Proposed order submitted by defense.

 *SEE ACTUAL ORDER*

State informs clerk and counsel that it will take approximately 6 weeks for the defendant to be produced from ICE for court appearance.  Date for motion is changed to 6-1-2016 at 8:15.
FILE RETAINED IN COURTROOM

Clerk contacted Atty Schrank to set motion to modify sentence hearing.  Hearing set for 4-26-2016 at 8:15.  Defendant is in ICE custody and the state will need to prepare a writ.  Clerk emailed  ADA Schoepp with information.
Sentencing transcript from December 4, 2015, attached to motion for sentence modification, received and filed (21 pages).
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. jbs
Defendant's motion to modify sentence.
SENTENCING HEARING Transcript commencing DECEMBER 4, 2015 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF3263 (21 Pages). kl

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, with credit for 178 (one hundred seventy-eight) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random urine screens.
-No Contact with victim Sara P.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment or attend school.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  

Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement. Court ordered future dates with Branch 25 (Honorable Judge Rothstein's) court vacated.
Sworn as Spanish interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in custody.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI not ordered.

Defense counsel contacted the court to request a plea and sentencing date prior to the final pretrial date. State notified. Case adjourned to 12/15/15 at 8:30 a.m. for plea and sentencing in Branch 25. Defense counsel to notify the court if the parties are able to have this matter heard in speedy disposition court prior to the next date. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Sworn as Interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. Defense counsel has not received discovery from prior counsel and is not prepared to proceed with the hearing today. Court granted defense request for adjournment. Defendant made statements to the Court. Case remains scheduled for final pretrial on 1/11/16 and for jury trial on 2/29/16. Parties to contact the court if a resolution is reached prior to the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Attorney Heather Johnson in court. Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez not in court, in custody. Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel. Interpreter not needed for this case as the defendant was not produced. Branch 25 in jury trial and unable to hear this matter. Defense counsel has not received discovery from prior counsel.  Defense anticipates resolution in this matter and requested the earliest available plea and sentencing date. Court ordered final pre-trial and jury trial dates be set in the event a resolution is not reached. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in branch 25.

Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in court with attorney Cynthia Herber.  Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in custody.  Kimberly Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's Report received and filed.  Doctor's report read by parties.  Parties do not dispute the findings and Court reinstates the proceedings. Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from Dr. Pankiewicz with attached competency examination report filed in defendant's pending misdemeanor case 14CM156 in Branch 33 received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in court with attorney Cynthia Herber.  Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Sworn as Interpreter: Daniel Lopez. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Due to the timeline of this case, Court ordered the jury trial date of 10/12/15 vacated. Court ordered a copy of the forensic evaluation ordered in the defendant's pending misdemeanor case 14CM156 be submitted to Branch 25. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion for Request for Competency Evaluation received and filed. Court will address the motion on the next court date. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defense's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defense's Proposed Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Motion in Limine filed by attorney Herber received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in court with attorney Cynthia Herber.  Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in custody.  Deann L Heard on behalf of Kimberly Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Sworn as Interpreter: Alejandra Klaric. Defense counsel withdrew the motion to withdraw plea filed on 8/24/15. Arguments heard as to the State's motion for joinder. Court GRANTED State's motion and ordered this matter joined for trial with case 15CF3263. Defense counsel to file final pretrial documents by 9/04/15. State will place the offer on the record at the next court appearance. Court ordered the jury trial date of 9/28/15 in this case be adjourned. This matter was set prior to rotation and Branch 25 will now be down and unable to hear this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Proposed verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Requested Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Clerk contact by defense counsel regarding the motion filed 8/24/15. Counsel will be withdrawing the motion on the next court date as it should have been filed in one of the defendant's other pending matters. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Clerk contacted defense counsel via telephone and advised counsel the Court will not take action on the motion filed 8/24/15 due to a plea not having been entered in this case. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Motion to Withdraw a Guilty Plea on a Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.
Memorandum in Support of Motion for Consolidation of Charges received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Jury trial set for 9/28/15 changed to 9:00 a.m. per Branch 25 schedule. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Attorney Cynthia Herber in court, defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense in a contest posture.  Parties to file any motions as set forth:  file motion within 20 days (by 7-20-15); any response 20 days thereafter (by 8-10-15); any reply 5 days thereafter (by 8-17-15).  Parties advised that motions to be addressed on final pre-trial date.  Parties advised effective August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25, Room G55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion for Modification of Bail and Conditions of Bond, received and filed.

Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set bail at $2,500.00 CASH with TOT to Justice Point: no firearms, weapons, drugs or alcohol; random testing; No Contact Orders remain in effect.  Previous cash bail on deposit remains forfeited to be used for any restitution for victim(s).

Attorney Cynthia Herber in court, defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Kimberly Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance.  Defendant returned on the warrant.  Defense counsel requested a scheduling date.  Court granted same.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Discharge Summary from  Justice Point dated 6/09/15, received and filed.
Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 6/09/15.  Bench Warrant filed.  Message left for Attorney Herber to contact the court regarding scheduling a date for return on warrant.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $750.00 pending any restitution due and owing any victim(s).
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Mr. Daniel Lopez, Spanish Interpreter, was present in court, but not sworn, as defendant did not appear.

Attorney Cynthia Herber in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  Court makes findings that there is a victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case. Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez not in court. Prosecuting Atty Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Justice Point Pretrial Report received and filed.

Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in court with attorney Cynthia Herber.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court is in trial.  Defense counsel speaks fluent Spanish and will advise client of new date.   All conditions of bail remain the same.   Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 20.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.   Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM021668  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/24/2015
Pretrial Release Conditions Order, signed and filed.
Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 4/22/15.  Bench Warrant filed.
TOT to Justice Point: no guns or weapons; no controlled substances or alcohol; No Contact Order remains.

Attorney Cynthia Herber in court, defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Entry made without file.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance for purposes of today's hearing.  Defendant turned himself in on the warrant.  Arguments on bail heard.  Court set bail at $500.00 cash.   Defense counsel requested a scheduling conference to allow time to meet with her client and go over discovery.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Herber indicated that she has made contact with her client; requested a return on warrant date.  Case tentatively set for 4/23/15 at 8:30 a.m. to allow defendant's warrant to clear.  Should defendant not be cleared for that date, counsel will contact the court to obtain another date.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Cynthia Herber in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Possible victim identified therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed:  Discharge Summary.

Attorney Cynthia Herber in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was in the building; defense counsel saw him and spoke to him while he was waiting in the security line.  He checked in with Branch 06; was sent by the deputy to Branch 44.  Both were in error.  Court issued but stayed a bench warrant to the next date.  Justice Point violations will be addressed with the court.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Violation Report (missed office contact 4/06/15), received and filed.

15RM016724  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-30-15

Attorney Cynthia Herber in court, defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested one more scheduling date; needs additional discovery and an offer letter.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cynthia Herber in court, defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date to go over offer with her client.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in court with attorney Cynthia Herber.  Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in custody.  Ron Dague for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Alexandra Wirth.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jennifer Kaine-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez not in court, defendant in custody.  Ron Dague for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State Public Defender's Office did not have counsel appointed to this case.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa.  Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted.  Public defenders office to appoint new counsel.  Email sent to public defenders office notifying them of withdrawal and need to appoint new counsel.   Court finds cause for adjournment.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SARA P. OR ALEXIS R.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Sworn as interpreter:  BRENDA BARTHOLOMEW.

Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Angel Nieves-Martinez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
